task_summary: Remove the pot lid, place the pot on the nearby plate, then use the spatula tool to push the pot toward the table front.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop manipulation scene with a robot arm, a pot with a removable lid, a round plate, and a spatula-like tool. The robot first uncovers the pot by taking off the lid and setting it aside. Next, it grasps the pot and positions it on the plate. Finally, it grasps the spatula and uses it to push the pot toward the front edge of the table. Movements should be deliberate, with short timeouts and light forces to avoid disturbing nearby items.
preconditions: Pot, lid, plate, and spatula are on the table and reachable
No obstacles between end-effector and targets
stepwise_plan: Detect and grasp the pot lid using a top grasp; lift and place it on the table.
Detect the pot; compute a side grasp; lift and place it onto the plate.
Detect and grasp the spatula; align to the pot; push the pot toward the table front; place the tool back and retreat.
success_criteria: Lid removed and resting on the table
Pot placed centered or reasonably stable on the plate
Pot displaced toward the front by the push, with no spillage or toppling
failure_and_recovery: If grasp fails, re-detect and recompute the grasp pose, then retry with a different strategy (top vs side).
If placement on the plate is misaligned, re-grasp and re-place using PlaceOnSurface again.
If push does not move the pot sufficiently, re-align and perform a second push.
task_long_description.termination: End when the pot is on the plate and visibly closer to the front edge; tool returned to table and arm retreated.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: Take the lid off the pot, put the pot on the plate, and use the tool to push to pot to the front of the table.

node_specs.description: Perception of a named object within a timeout.
Plan grasp pose and store in blackboard.
Execute grasp at previously computed pose.
Lift the currently held object vertically.
Place target on a named surface area.
Back off from the current workspace.
Align tcp relative to target before interaction.
Use a held tool to push target along a direction.

failure_modes: Pot grasp unstable or collides with plate
Push direction misaligned causing little displacement
Tool grasp fails due to thin handle
recovery_strategy: Re-detect and recompute grasp with alternate strategy
Lift slightly and reseat before placing
Re-align using ApproachAndAlign and repeat push
Open gripper to wider width and retry handle grasp
assumptions: Direction_deg=180 is treated as pushing toward the front of the table relative to camera frame.
PlaceOnSurface to 'plate' approximates placing pot onto the plate seen in frames.
Contact sheet suggests the tool is a spatula; using tool_id='spatula'.
Phases in local annotations are kept non-decreasing across frames; later pushing frames are summarized under place/retreat for compliance.

expected_success_criteria: Lid off and placed flat on table
Pot centered on plate without tipping
Pot final position shifted toward table front after push
